dc_title_s: Zoning Map, Hudson, Massachusetts, ca. 200u (Raster Image)
dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: Town of Hudson, Massachusetts, zoning, map produced and printed by GES Consulting. It was published by GES Consulting ca. 200-. Scale [ca. 1:26,600]. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Massachusetts State Plane Coordinate System, Mainland Zone (in Feet) (Fipszone 2001). All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as roads, cities and other human settlements, territorial boundaries, and more. Includes also zoning districts and legend, road information, data disclaimer and credits, and inset of town location within state. This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from the Harvard Map Collection. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features. The selection represents a range of originators, ground condition dates, scales, and map purposes.
